thread.section_title: Archive News & Video for Tuesday, 24 Apr 2018 | Reuters.com
thread.title: BRIEF-Canada Minister Freeland says auto rules will be the heart of NAFTA deal

author: Reuters Editorial
title: BRIEF-Canada Minister Freeland says auto rules will be the heart of NAFTA deal
text:
* CANADA MINISTER FREELAND SAYS NAFTA PARTNERS ARE MAKING GOOD PROGRESS ON AUTOS, BUT ISSUE IS “FIENDISHLY COMPLEX”
* CANADA MINISTER FREELAND SAYS MEETING AT USTR TO FOCUS ON AUTOS RULES OF ORIGIN
* CANADA MINISTER FREELAND SAYS NAFTA DEAL “WILL BE DONE WHEN WE’RE DONE”
* CANADA MINISTER FREELAND DECLINES TO COMMENT ON SPECIFICS OF NAFTA AUTOS NEGOTIATIONS, REPEATS THAT GOOD PROGRESS BEING MADE
* CANADA MINISTER FREELAND SAYS BELIEVES AUTOS RULES WILL BE “THE HEART” OF NAFTA DEAL
* CANADA MINISTER FREELAND SAYS NEGOTIATIONS ARE IN “VERY INTENSIVE PHASE”, NEGOTIATORS WORKED OVER THE WEEKEND AND AGAIN ON MONDAY
* CANADA MINISTER FREELAND SAYS MODERNIZED NAFTA THAT IS A “WIN WIN WIN” OUTCOME IS ABSOLUTELY POSSIBLE AND COULD BE REALLY GOOD FOR WORKERS IN ALL 3 COUNTRIES (Reporting by David Lawder)
